alert.note: Alert for Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 11 at 7:07PM MDT until June 12 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED AT 7 PM MDT... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .An upper level low approaching from the west will continue to spread strong south to southwest winds across parts of the region Monday. The combination of strong winds with very low humidity, warm temperatures, and unstable conditions will create critical fire weather. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124) on Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
